TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IAppServiceTokenHandler

Docs.summary: Provides an abstraction for handling security tokens. This abstraction can be used for validating security tokens and creating instances.

Public Function CreateUserId (providerName As String, providerUserId As String) As String
abstract member CreateUserId : string * string -> string

Docs.summary: Creates a user id value contained within a . The user id is of the form ProviderName:ProviderId where the ProviderName is the unique identifier for the login provider and the ProviderId is the provider specific id for a given user.
Docs.returns: A formatted representing the resulting value.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.SuppressMessage("Microsoft.Design", "CA1021:AvoidOutParameters", Justification="This is not unreasonable for this API.")

Docs.param: The login provider name; or null if the is not valid.
The provider specific user id; or null is the is not valid.
Docs.summary: Parses a user id into its two components: a ProviderName which uniquely identifies the login provider and the ProviderId which identifies the provider specific id for a given user.
Docs.returns: true if is valid; otherwise false/
